did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 20 manuscript boxes, 2 card file boxes, 1 oversize box

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Notes, drafts, photocopies of French governmental documents, computer data cards, press summaries, and printed matter, relating to French politics and foreign policy during the Third and Fourth Republics, and especially to the career of the French politician André Tardieu. Mostly research material for the doctoral dissertation by W. E. Adams, "André Tardieu and French Foreign Policy, 1902-1919" (Stanford University, 1959). Includes some original notes by Tardieu.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Increments may have been received since this finding aid was prepared. Please check Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat to find the full extent of the collection.

chronitem.event: Bachelor of Science degree, University of Oregon
Special assistant to the Executive Officer, United States of America Operations Mission to France
Assistant professor of European history, Arizona State University
Visiting professor, University of California, Santa Barbara

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Wallace E. Adams papers in the Hoover Institution Archives consist primarily of Adams's writings and the research materials he accumulated over an academic career devoted to 20th century French history and, in particular, the career of the French politician André Tardieu. There is also a considerable amount of materials relating to Adams's service in France as an aid official with the United States of America Operations Mission to France, a successor to activities of the Marshall Plan.

Adams completed his doctoral dissertation on Tardieu at Stanford University, and continued to conduct research on Tardieu's role in French politics, especially in relation to French colonial policies in Africa, thereafter. He collected a number of primary sources, including some of Tardieu's notebooks and unpublished writings, which form a separate series within the collection (see ANDRÉ TARDIEU FILE). There is a good deal of material in the collection relating to the so-called N'Goko Sangha affair in French West Africa and its possible impact on the origins of World War I, including copies of company records and official correspondence (see RESEARCH MATERIALS).

As a graduate student, Adams had become interested in the possibilities afforded by computers to quantify trends in modern French politics. RESEARCH MATERIALS contains Adams's work in this regard, including statistical analyses of parliamentary voting records and government instability during the French Third Republic.

The series concerning Adams's service in France during the 1950s contains press summaries and other materials that provide information on American perceptions of French politics and economic life during a period of Cold War tensions (see UNITED STATES OF AMERICA OPERATIONS MISSION TO FRANCE FILE).

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent
Article, chronology, dissertation, notes, outlines, and paper, arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Paper on the Croix de Feu, n.d.
"The Political and Social Structure of the French Chamber of Deputies, 1924-1928," 1955
"André Tardieu and French Foreign Policy, 1902-1919," doctoral dissertation, Stanford University, 1955
"Cabinet Instability in the French Third Republic," 1963

scopecontent.p: Biographical file, correspondence, voting record, and writings, arranged alphabetically by physical form
Printed copies of memorial pamphlets, and typescript of speech by Michel Missoffe at dedication of plaque commemorating Tardieu, Paris, France, 1953 July 6
Copies of letters sent by Tardieu to Michel Missoffe
Booklet recording Tardieu's votes in the French Chamber of Deputies
Tardieu's transcription of secret sessions of the French parliament

did.unittitle: Outline for book on history of Western Europe, c. 1930s

scopecontent.p: Unpublished manuscript transcribed by Wallace E. Adams
Typescript, with English translation by Adams

did.unittitle: United States of America Operations Mission to France File, 1948-1954.

scopecontent.p: Articles and clippings, briefing book, briefing papers, correspondence, filing manual, personnel list, press summaries, printed matter, reports, and speeches, arranged alphabetically by physical form

Album, articles, bibliographies, biographical data sheets, clippings, code sheets, company records, computer codes, correspondence, indexes, interviews, maps, monograph excerpts, monographs, official correspondence, notebooks, notes, parliamentary records, serial issues, voting statistics, and work sheets, arranged chronologically by date research undertaken or published, and by physical form therein

did.unittitle: "The Political and Social Structure of the French Chamber of Deputies, 1924-1928," published 1955
"André Tardieu and French Foreign Policy, 1902-1919," submitted 1959
Clippings, correspondence, and notes relating to André Tardieu, 1917-1956.

scopecontent.p: Includes copies of letters written by Tardieu to Michel Missoffe, and Wallace E. Adams's correspondence with Jacques Debu-Bridel, Pierre Mille, Michel Missoffe, René Picard, François Piétri, and Pierre Poujet

did.unittitle: Clippings, correspondence, interviews, and notes relating to André Tardieu, 1945-1954.

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Wallace E. Adams and Henri Cangardel, Maurice Gamelin, H. Stuart Hughes, Gabriel Puaux, Jacques Rey, Max Terrier, and Gordon Wright. Also includes some correspondence neither to nor from Wallace E. Adams

did.unittitle: The N'Goko Sangha affair and French colonialism, undertaken 1962-1970s
Official correspondence, largely between the French Foreign Ministry and the Compagnie N'Boko Sangha
"Cabinet Instability in the French Third Republic," undertaken 1963-1970s

scopecontent.p: Note cards relating to Wallace E. Adams's research on French historical subjects, especially concerning André Tardieu
Ninety-three short strips of microfilmed documents relating to the Versailles Peace Conference of 1919
One negative and five prints depicting André Tardieu; four prints depicting the residence of André Tardieu; three prints depicting Michel Missoffe(?)
Monographs and serial issues, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Michel Missoffe, La vie volontaire d'André Tardieu, 1930
